definitions.definition: To give in trust; to put into charge or keeping; to entrust; to consign; used with to or formerly unto.
To put in charge of a jailer; to imprison.
To have (a person) enter an establishment, such as a hospital or asylum, as a patient.
definitions.example: Tony should be committed to a nuthouse!

definitions.definition: To do (something bad); to perpetrate, as a crime, sin, or fault.
definitions.example: to commit a series of heinous crimes

definitions.definition: To join a contest; to match; followed by with.
To pledge or bind; to compromise, expose, or endanger by some decisive act or preliminary step. (Traditionally used only reflexively but now also without oneself etc.)
definitions.example: to commit oneself to a certain action

definitions.definition: To make a set of changes permanent.
To commit an offence; especially, to fornicate.
To be committed or perpetrated; to take place; to occur.
Obligated by a pledge to some course of action.
Associated in an exclusive (but not necessarily permanent) sexual relationship.
Required by logic to endorse the conclusion of an argument.
